title: King Ranch Casserole
full_text:
King Ranch Casserole
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
25 mins
Cook
100 mins
Cooling Time
10 mins
Total
2 hrs 15 mins
Serves
6
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
For the Poached Chicken:
1 1/2
tablespoons
cumin seeds
3
boneless, skinless chicken breasts
(
10
ounces/
283g each; 30 ounces/849g total)
6
cups
(1.5L)
unsalted chicken broth
,
homemade
or store-bought, at room temperature
2 small
jalapeño
chiles (1 ounce;
28
g
), halved and unseeded
1
tablespoon
(9g) Diamond Crystal
kosher salt
; if using table salt, use half as much by volume
For the Casserole:
18
(about 5 1/2-inch)
corn tortillas
(see notes)
Nonstick
cooking spray
3 tablespoons
unsalted butter
(
1 1/2
ounces
; 42g)
1
large
yellow onion
(10 ounces; 284g), chopped
2
large
red bell peppers
(about 5 3/4 ounces; 166g each), chopped
1 large
poblano pepper
(
3 1/2
ounces
; 100g), seeded and chopped
3 medium
cloves garlic
(
15
g
), finely chopped
1/4 cup
all-purpose flour
(about
1
ounce
; 30g)
1
tablespoon
chili powder
2 1/2
teaspoons
granulated
chicken bouillon
, such as Maggi
One
10
-
ounce
can
diced tomatoes
and green chiles, such as Rotel, drained
1/2
cup
(120ml)
heavy cream
1
cup
chopped
fresh cilantro
(1 ounce; 28g), plus more for garnish
1/3 cup
sour cream
(about
2 3/4
ounces
; 76g)
1 1/2
teaspoon
Diamond Crystal
kosher salt
; for table salt, use half as much by volume
2 1/2
cups
Monterey Jack cheese
, shredded (10 ounces; 280g), divided
Directions
For the Poached Chicken:
In a medium pot set over medium heat, toast cumin seeds, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 40 seconds. Add chicken, chicken broth, chiles, and salt. Increase heat to medium-high and cook until broth is just shy of a simmer and the temperature registers between 150º and 160ºF (65 to 70ºC) on an instant-read thermometer, about 12 minutes. (See notes.)
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Reduce heat to low to maintain the temperature of the broth. (To help maintain the temperature, increase or reduce the heat as needed, and/or re-position the pot over stovetop burner so that the heat source only partially touches bottom of the pot.) Cook until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest portion of chicken registers 150°F (65ºC), 30 to 35 minutes. Carefully transfer chicken to a large bowl, and let rest until chicken is cool enough to handle, about 10 minutes. Using 2 forks, shred chicken; set aside. Using a fine-mesh strainer set over a large bowl, strain broth; discard solids. Set aside 2 1/2 cups (592ml) broth. Reserve remaining broth for another use.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
While chicken cooks, prepare the casserole:
Adjust oven racks to top third and lower third positions and preheat oven to 400ºF (205ºC). Arrange tortillas on 2 large rimmed baking sheets (they will be slightly overlapping). Lightly spray both sides with cooking spray. (Alternatively, use pastry brush to lightly brush tortillas with a thin layer of neutral oil.)
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Bake until slightly crisp and browned in spots, about 14 minutes, flipping tortillas halfway through and rotating baking sheets between top and bottom racks. Remove from oven and let cool until ready to use. (Tortillas will continue to crisp as they cool.)
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
In a large pot or Dutch oven set over medium-high, melt butter. Add onion, bell pepper, poblano, and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 8 minutes. Add flour, chili powder, and granulated chicken bouillon. Cook, stirring often, until fragrant and flour just begins to stick to bottom of the pot, about 1 minute. Add diced tomatoes and green chiles, cream, and 2 1/2 cups reserved broth; bring to a simmer over medium-high. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened, about 4 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in cilantro, sour cream, salt, and shredded chicken until thoroughly combined.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
To assemble, place 6 tortillas in the bottom of a 9- by 13-inch baking dish. Spoon 3 cups of the chicken mixture over tortillas, and top with 1/2 cup of Monterey Jack cheese. Repeat with second layer. Top with remaining 6 tortillas, remaining 2 cups chicken mixture, and remaining 1 1/2 cups cheese.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Bake, uncovered, at 400°F on top third rack of oven until bubbling and browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Garnish with additional cilantro.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Special Equipment
Medium pot, rimmed baking sheet, large pot or Dutch oven, 9- by 13-inch baking dish
Notes
Crushed tortilla chips can be used in place of the crisper tortillas, but they won’t yield even layers or be as flavorful as the tortillas.
If you don’t have an instant read thermometer, the water should be about poaching temperature when wisps of steam begin to rise from the water.
If you’d like to skip the poaching step and substitute rotisserie chicken, add 2 teaspoons ground cumin and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper along with the flour and chili powder in step 5.
A combination of Monterey Jack and cheddar cheese can be used, if desired.
Make-Ahead and Storage
The casserole can be made 1 day in advance. Prepare casserole through step 6. Let cool slightly, uncovered, at room temperature for 1 hour. Cover with aluminum foil and refrigerate up to 24 hours. When ready to serve, uncover and let casserole come to room temperature for 30 minutes while oven preheats to 400ºF (205ºC). Bake, uncovered, until bubbling and browned and casserole is heated through, about 25 minutes, loosely covering with aluminum foil to prevent overbrowning, if needed. Garnish and serve as directed.
Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days, but the tortillas will soften as they sit.
